en-US.invite_message:
Thanks for inviting me to this channnel, u/{inviter}!
I'm u/{me}, your friendly bot asssistant,
and you can do {prefix}commands to get started.

en-US.isalias_false: The command, {}, is not an alias.
language_updated: My language has been updated to {} here.
en-US.language_not_available: Sorry, but I cannot speak that language currently.

en-US.version_hash: I am running version {}, with the most recent commit being {}!
whoami: Ah, silly humans, always forgetting their names. I won't throw you under the shade too much this time, though, u/{}.
Do you need to write 'u/{}' on your hand so you can remember?
whereami: Don't you have a GPS or something? Whatever, you're in {} right now.

That word is not currently in Urban Dictionary.

invalid_timezone: That's not a valid time zone.
That's not a time zone I've heard of!

en-US.support_invite_error: Sorry, something went wrong with the invitation!
support_invited: I've invited you to the support channel.
Check your channel invites; I've sent an invite for the support channel to you.
en-US.update_join_message: The join message has been updated.
en-US.clear_join_message: The join message will not be sent.
en-US.update_join_message_no_change: That is already the join message.
clear_join_message_no_change: I haven't been sending the join message.
I'd stop sending the join message, if not for the fact that I haven't been doing that in the first place.
en-US.update_leave_message: The leave message has been updated.
en-US.clear_leave_message: The leave message will not be sent.

clear_leave_message_no_change: I haven't been sending the leave message.
I'd stop sending the join message, if not for the fact that I haven't been doing that in the first place.

en-US.info:
I am u/{0}, ready to help you with anything you need!
My prefix is {1}, so to find a command you just do {1}command.
I was made by haykam821, but please direct all questions and concerns via {1}feedback!
github: My source code is available at {}!
You can find my source code at {}.

feedback_error: Sorry, but something went wrong when I tried to send the feedback.

I have recieved the following message from u/{} in {}:

{}
feedback_success: I have contacted my creator for you.
Your feedback has been passed on to my creator. Thank you for sending it!

Happy {0} to you,
happy {0} to you!
Happy {0}, dear {1}...
happy {0} to you!
birthday_user_unspecified: Wait a second... who am I singing happy {} to again?
delete_faq_success: That FAQ has been purged from existence.
delete_faq_nonexistent: That FAQ doesn't even exist, silly. See {}listfaq for a list of deletable FAQs.
I'm looking at the list of FAQs right now and don't see one with an identifier of '{1}'. Are you sure you gave me the right one, as viewable in {0}listfaq?
I don't see a FAQ with an identifier of '{1}'. Is the FAQ you gave me one of the ones seen in {0}listfaq?
There is no FAQ with that ID, so I cannot delete it. For a list of FAQs that exist and thus are able to be deleted, type {}listfaq.
en-US.delete_faq_unspecified: You need to specify a FAQ to delete. To get a list of FAQs, type {}listfaq.
en-US.faq_nonexistent: There is no FAQ with that identifier. For a list of FAQs that exist, type {}listfaq.
en-US.faq_unspecified: You need to specify an identifier for the FAQ you want to show. To find this list, type {}listfaq.
en-US.set_faq_message_success_update: That FAQ message (with ID '{}') has been updated.
en-US.set_faq_message_success_create: A FAQ message (with ID '{}') has been created!
en-US.set_faq_message_unspecified: You need to specify the message for the FAQ. If you would like to get rid of this FAQ, use {}delfaq.
en-US.set_faq_id_unspecified: You need to specify a FAQ to change. To get a list of FAQs, type {}listfaq.
en-US.no_faqs: There are no {type}. You can make one by using {prefix}setfaq.
die_land: After a couple of bounces, the die finally settles on a {}.
The die falls off the table, but lands on a {}.

en-US.custom_roll_notation_unspecified: Specify the dice you want to roll using standard notation.
en-US.custom_roll_max: Sorry, but I will not be able to handle that request; it's simply too much for me.
en-US.custom_roll_results: Dice output: {}, with a total of {}.
matrix_amount_too_low: We need at least some binary. Give me a number bigger than that.
To hack into the NSA, we need to have some binary. Please give me a number bigger than that.
matrix_amount_too_high: If I give you that much, it'll spam up the channel. Out of courtesy, please give me an amount lower than that.
Woah there! That's a lot of binary. If I post that, we might hack the simulation.
en-US.color_amount_too_low: I need to provide you with at least one name for this color.
en-US.color_amount_too_high: I cannot provide you with {} colors because that would spam this chat.
en-US.color_amount_invalid: Please provide a proper integer for the amount of color names you would like to me to give.
en-US.color_names: The closest names for this color are {}.
en-US.color_invalid: That color is invalid. Please provide a hexadecimal color, such as {}.
color_unspecified: Give me a color to name.
In order to name your color, I need a color to name.
How am I supposed to name nothing? You need to provide me with a color.

en-US.string_argument_regexp_fail: The {2} provided for the '{key}' argument does not follow the allowed format.

en-US.string_argument_too_short: The {2} provided for the '{key}' argument is too short; the minimum length allowed is {minLength} characters long.
